author: {'steamid': '76561198061762323', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1518980219}
review:
[h1]Ghoul kid, a spoopy game[/h1]
Ghoul kid is a game where the player takes control of a ghost whom just wants some interaction with humans, not the Casper the friendly ghost type, more like a jigsaw type.
Your mission consists in scarying to death your intruders in form of waves, which consist in three types: children (takes two scares), the milf (takes 3-4 scares) and the coward dad (takes 3 scares), the enemy variety isn't there, the devs could had jeovah's witnesses, and more annoying stereotypes for more fun.
To scare people to death your ghost must possess the objects around the house (radio, tv, piano, blender, microwave, jackinthebox, etc...) the collection of objects is very constrained but the size of each house division can help you drain the souls faster.
The sound consists on a single track that can make you slowly descend into madness or shutdown the music.
The game has three modes: normal ( which tells your story - 10 waves ), trick or threat (10 waves on children that you have to scare to death) and Double Trouble (10 waves - i call it story 2).

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Although the game isn't anything new or inovative, it still is a kind of fun, sure there are limitations in terms of object interaction, enemy design, lack of personality on the main character (yes i know it's a ghost but there are good ghosts), and repetion can become a turn off, but if you like the discount neightbors from hell vibe, and have a few time to spare and want some easy acheviements give it a shot, for me it waas simply not worth it.

review:
[h1]"Haunt the habitants"[/h1]
What a nice little F2P fun game. You are a ghost and like to scare 3 different family members (Mom, Dad, children) to death. The old cliche that Moms have the strongest stomach is prooved again. They need 4 scares to die, Dads 3 scares and the children 2 scares. So haunt them in that order. Btw why are the Moms mostly fleeing into the kitchen? Ok, sorry. That was a really bad chauvenistic joke by me.

The controls are a little bit clunky. Especially the floor change and the use of the minimap. There could be some pointer for the last remaining survivors. The gameplay is simple like search for scare objects and activate them when many ppl are in its circle. Lateron there are 2 more gamemodes. Halloween mode means loads of little children flooding the house but you can kill them with one hits. And double-trouble mode is ppl are moving double fast but also the scare object animations are double fast. So the hardest mode is still beating the main game. Some grindy achievements in the end but also a perfect integration of XBox Controller. If you don't get nerved by the music loop this is a nice casual fun for some hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1574014997}
review:
Wow....a half-way decent Unity game.  I'm a little surprised... and it's a student project from EAE (a game development school in Utah.  Same school behind [i]Maui[/i]).

Welcome to [i]Ghoul Kid[/i], the game where you get to play as Sans from [i]Undertale[/i] as you take over Lewis' job from the Mystery Skulls animations.  Your goal is to scare visitors of the house to death.  These victims include Angelica Pickles (Rugrats) / a younger Helga Pataki (Hey Arnold!) as well as Judy Neutron and a morbidly obese Hugh Neutron (Jimmy Neutron).  Your job is to make sure that they're gonna have....a bad time.~

You have 3 modes:  Regular mode, "kill tons of little girls" mode (or "Pedophile mode"), double speed mode,

PROS:
+ Play as Sans
+ Free
+ Achievements

CONS:
- Kinda' annoying
- Sometimes time isn't enough
- Music loop is irritating
- Sometimes you stay inside a possession object for too long (choose your objects wisely)

If you ever wanted to play as Sans, then have at it.  I don't think I'll pick this game up again, though....

5/10  Play as Sans, but gets old.  Gets boring fast.

review:
Ghoul kid seems like an inspiration from the Sega Genesis game "Haunting".  You play as ghoul kid (a ghostly apparition) who needs to haunt objects in a home to kill the strangerâ€™s visiting it.  

There are three different types of enemies who differ in the amount of items you need to haunt near them to kill and the models.  Killing a certain type of enemy will give you point towards a power up that can be activated to assist you.  All enemies in a wave need to die before 99 seconds expire or you lose.  It appears that the waves are endless, but I only made it to wave 6 before getting overwhelmed.  All controls are customizable and there appears to be a fair amount of video settings.  The one setting that this game is missing is audio as the music can be a little annoying after time.

In my opinion, this game does not offer much in replay ability in spite of the 3 modes that can be selected.  If this is the developers first attempt at creating a game, he did a phenomenal job.  However, I donâ€™t recommend this game more than just a 5-10 min time waster.  This game would probably benefit more from being on a mobile device. 

If you would like to see more of this game please check out the link below.  I have created other videos for free games on steam if you would like to check them out.  https://youtu.be/Rf6EdO5T8qU

review:
It's a free game. You're a Ghost haunting a mansion and you're trying to scare potential buyers to your mansion. The concept is like Casper, the friendly ghost. I would probably recommend this to people to try once since it's free, but that's the end of it. Nothing really interesting beyond triggering traps.

PROS
1. It's free
Free stuff. You even have to check a box that says "Check this box if you received this product for free."

2. The Different Scares
I kind of liked how the different objects did different things when they scared people.

CONS
1. Repetitive
You do nothing except inhabiting items by pressing E and triggering it when the victims get close by. You know your aura radius based on the circle. Very similar to activating traps.

2. Controls.
Left Click to Float Up, Right Click to Float Down. Those aren't intuitive. I would have preferred Spacebar to float up and Left Ctrl to Float Down

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1462072909}
review:
[h1]It's quite amusing[/h1]
You play a ghoul in a house. Various numbers of people enter the house per round, and your job is to possess objects and scare each of them till they reach a certain threshold and drop dead of shock. There is a timer so you have to do it fast, or [i]you[/i] end up being the dead one. (That is, if ghouls can even die.)

[h1]It has issues with movement[/h1]
The game is in 3D - using the keyboard with your left hand, you have to control how near/far your ghoul is, and using the mouse with your right hand, you control how high/low he is. This wouldn't be a problem, except for the "sliding" that occurs with each move. That is, if you stop pressing the left mouse button or the "left" command on the keyboard for instance, your ghoul doesn't immediately stop, but continues to move a bit more before he finally does. This lack of precision with the controls makes it hard to accurately control your ghoul, and becomes especially frustrating because there is a timer every round, so not having precise movement wastes the amount of time you have left.

[h1]Would've been better with some semblance of a story[/h1]
Or at least, a point to all of this. Of course, scaring peeps is fun, but how about a bit of backstory as to why you became a ghoul, why you're haunting this house, what you hope to achieve, and so on. Just sayin'.

[h1]It's free though[/h1]
With that in mind, go give this game a try. The premise is pretty interesting, the graphics alright, and the objects you get to possess quite fun. (There's a grand piano, grandfather clock, and trophy bear among many others.)

[code]U P D A T E

As of my last edit, this game is in a somewhat unfinished state and there are a few bugs/problems. These are a few that I encountered:

- You can sometimes get "stuck" in the piano after you possess it;
- Game jams up periodically (after you press "restart" the timer just gets stuck);
- Power-ups 1 and 2 are virtually useless (i.e. they don't do anything);
- No audio during the tutorial (no, it's not your speakers that are faulty);
- People in the house can jam each other up, especially if there are too many of them.[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198301963247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1461780253}
review:
Cool idea for a game, I don't feel its a stretch for this games potential.

This review will be mostly critique as I am hoping to see improvements to this game. I really want to be able to recommend Ghoul Kid in the future.


Graphics for the Ghoul Kid feel more polished than the levels and other characters, almost like conflicting/different art styles.   Ghoul kid looks awesome

Was hard to get a good grasp of the game with the slow camera movement.   I didn't like how the character can move out of the screen.   I think a more fluid camera where it feels like your flying with ghoul kid would be a nice touch.  To be honest the camera made me want to stop playing. 

I think ghoul kids animation needs to be faster or he needs to move slower.   The animation doesn't match the movement speed.

I found it hard to use the mouse and the keyboard for movement.   I feel the game would function better as a 3D platformer like super smash bros with 2 deminsions of control.

Ideas?   Perhaps not imobilizing ghost kid when haunting. Then you could do combo scares and direct the scares more.  Perhaps different types of traps.  ex. instead of using the phone to scare, the AI could move towards it.  Also activating a trap too early could cause the character to run in the opposite direction.   

Its a good start, congrats on finishing your first release.  Catchy name

review:
I really, really can't recommend this.  If you want to scare the mortal fools, go look up Haunt the House-it's a 2D version that this was obviously inspired by, it doesn't have the relentless timer or the serious control issues with changing rooms/floors, and it's free.

If you'd rather play on Steam, you can pay for a different version of Haunt the House right here... though if you're determined to pay, I'd highly recommend the old-but-good Ghost Master instead.  Why control a single, simpleminded poltergeist when you can have an entire cadre of spirits and haunts set up so they're ready to hammer a panicked lout who's fleeing from the last scary encounter?
